instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message:
A friend asked me about a 2012 mbp he just bought. 
It boots when he plug in magsafe but the powerbutton have no function. The keyboard is working fine. 
He's gonna send it to me. 
Is it something on the board that can cause the powerbutton to stop working?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: Did you try to short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: I dont have the mbp yet. It arrives next week

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: First try this And reporte back if it works this way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: Guess liquid damage keyboard. tray new keyboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: Strange if liquid only destroys powerbutton

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: Not strange at all. Incredibly common on this model. 99% chance it's the keyboard, replace and be happy.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message:
Got the computer today.
I have tried three known good keyboards but no powerbutton fuction.
Shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground dosent change anything

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: What is the voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR>? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> is 3.42 volt 
meassured <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R6961</RESISTOR> and it is 3.45 volt. 
But now when the logic board is removed from the case the powerbutton works with only keyboard and battery plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: That is because if you plug in the battery indicator it pulls down <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. Check again with BIL connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powerbutton
threads.message: yes that is correct. doesnt work with indicator connected
